definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]

sentences.english: Then disengage from the Gregorian mind trap and re-connect with the synchronic order.
sentences.chinese: 然后脱离阳历铭记陷阱和重新连接同步秩序。

sentences.english: The date usually falls in mid-January.
sentences.chinese: 这个节日通常在阳历一月中旬来临。

sentences.english: Chinese calendar is a combination of solar and lunar calendar.
sentences.chinese: 中国历是阳历和阴历的结合。

sentences.english: The date of the Laba Festival usually falls in mid-January.
sentences.chinese: 腊八节的阳历日期通常在1月中旬。

sentences.english: Today is her birthday according to the solar calendar.
sentences.chinese: 按照阳历，今天是她的生日。

sentences.english: It is built according to the solar calendar.
It falls around April 5 of the Gregorian calendar.
sentences.chinese: 它是在阳历四月五号前后。

sentences.english: When did you change the date of Yuandan to the solar calendar?
sentences.chinese: 你们什么时候把元旦日期变成阳历的。

sentences.english: That was on June the 4 th , two days after the Dragonboat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 那正是旧历端阳节后二天，阳历六月四日。

definition: the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
intercalary month in the lunar calendar/leap month
method of calculating a person's age in years from birth/see also 虛歲|虚岁[xu1 sui4]/see also 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
Year of the Ox or Bull (e.g. 2009)
birth year as designated by animal symbols (mouse, ox, tiger etc)
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
Chunfen or Spring Equinox, 4th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st March-4th April
